headline: AMD pops, Sarepta tanks, EchoStar & Trump: Trending Tickers
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock is on the rise after Piper Sandler analysts lifted their price target for the stock to $140. Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT) stock plunges after the company reported a second patient death from its experimental gene therapy trial. EchoStar (SATS) stock skyrockets and sees price hikes as US President Trump urges the company and the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to settle a dispute in an ongoing wireless spectrum licensing investigation. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Why Advanced Micro Devices Rallied Today
summary: AMD got a price target bump from a Wall Street analyst today.  The move comes on the heels of last week's big artificial intelligence (AI) GPU introduction event for the new MI350 accelerators and upcoming Helios racks.  Today, a Wall Street analyst wrote his positive conclusion on the event, and revealed some positive industry data in the PC space, too.

headline: Why AMD (AMD) Stock Is Up Today
summary: Shares of computer processor maker AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) jumped 9.4% in the afternoon session after Piper Sandler analysts maintained a Buy rating and raised the price target from $125 to $140. Following talks with management, the analysts became more bullish on AMD's AI business and expect the segment to grow even faster when the tariff headwinds in China have passed. They also highlighted the growing conviction on Wall Street regarding one of AMD's hyperscaler clients.

They also highlighted the growing conviction on Wall Street regarding one of AMD's hyperscaler clients.

headline: AMD Stock Is Today’s Best in S&P 500. Product Launches Have These Analysts Excited.
summary: At its Advancing AI event last week in San Jose, the chip maker unveiled the AMD Instinct MI350 series of chips, which are designed to compete with market leader  Nvidia  The company also previewed its Helios rack, powered by Instinct MI400 series chips, which will be released in 2026 and made available in configurations of up to 72 chips in one server.  AMD shares slipped during the event Thursday and held steady on Friday.  Analysts at Piper Sandler left last week’s conference and an analyst call on Friday upbeat about AMD, maintaining an Overweight rating on the stock and lifting their price target to $140 from $125.

raw.headline: AMD Stock Is Today’s Best in S&P 500. Product Launches Have These Analysts Excited.
raw.summary: At its Advancing AI event last week in San Jose, the chip maker unveiled the AMD Instinct MI350 series of chips, which are designed to compete with market leader  Nvidia  The company also previewed its Helios rack, powered by Instinct MI400 series chips, which will be released in 2026 and made available in configurations of up to 72 chips in one server.  AMD shares slipped during the event Thursday and held steady on Friday.  Analysts at Piper Sandler left last week’s conference and an analyst call on Friday upbeat about AMD, maintaining an Overweight rating on the stock and lifting their price target to $140 from $125.
